programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Baggage

programme.title: Baggage
programme.desc: Contestants on this dating game show don't want to hear the elimination line "I'm sorry, but you have too much baggage." How much is acceptable among three contestants in each episode is determined by the "dater," who hears the candidates' intimate secrets and hidden flaws, as well as their attempts to deflect these traits by describing their positive attributes. After two elimination rounds leave one remaining contestant, it's the dater's turn to reveal his or her own baggage ... and then the contestant decides to go forward with the date or not. Jerry Springer hosts.

programme.desc: A dater must choose between men whose baggage includes sleeping in footed pajamas and fainting at the sight of spiders.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Its no doubt that the Ball Crusher Sweeper is the star of tonights show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this weeks Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk training comes into play.

programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. Its all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. Nat with the Tats and Renee Lets get physical move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. Its a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles autumn lawn maintenance tasks, Carol Klein is looking at burnets, and we meet a man who's dedicated himself to a North American prairie favourite, the echinacea.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost continues to develop his new woodland border, ably assisted by Ash the cat. He also gets to work on his veg plot and has a few tips on how to get the best out of the native bluebell.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels from the north west coast of Scotland to the north east coast of England, from historic reconstructions to modern re-inventions. He visits some of the most inhospitable places in the country and finds gardens that are flourishing.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across some of the country's landscapes, heading across the north of England to Northern Ireland. Here, Monty sees the ingenuity, passion and determination of British people to garden and create gardens, no matter what the canvas.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the middle of the country, from Wales to Norfolk. He comes across gardens for gnomes, much-loved, well-tended allotments and extravagant gardens that bankrupted their owners.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the most densely populated part of the country, London and the home counties. He visits some of London's gardens, including a special one on a barge, as well as a beautifully restored garden close to where he grew up in Hampshire.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the south west of the country to visit some of Britain's most exotic gardens. On this journey, Monty also goes to some of the country's most historic gardens, as well as some challenging contemporary ones.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's all about the maintenance this week at Longmeadow, as Monty cuts back and divides spring flowering plants. Joe Swift and Adam Frost meet up in Leicestershire to see how they can help a couple of novice gardeners turn a neglected area of their garden into a useable and useful space. Nick Bailey goes to Ham House in Richmond to see how they are coping with the ravages of box tree caterpillar and Arit Anderson visits a garden in Suffolk to find out about the concept of rewilding.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn unfolds in the garden, Monty Don has plenty to be getting on with at Longmeadow. In his quest to track down some of the nations most remarkable allotments, Joe Swift visits a tropical paradise in Runcorn.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow with a host of seasonal jobs to keep his autumn garden looking beautiful for as long as possible, and in the third of her fascinating films about how plants work, Carol Klein investigates the science of stems.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives tips on moving plants which are in the wrong place or have outgrown their space, shows how to store chilies and harvests the last of his tomatoes. Rachel de Thame returns to Longmeadow to talk to Monty about her return to health and to plant up pots for spring colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn gathers momentum, it's time to start putting the garden to bed for winter. Monty Don has some timely advice on what to do. Carol Klein meets a nurseryman in Herefordshire and together they indulge in the beauty of the Japanese maple.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty adds a touch of the exotic to the damp garden by planting a tree fern, and protects his new soft fruit garden from feathered predators with netting. Also Carol Klein selects hardy geraniums as her June `Plant of the Month'.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Rachel de Thame joins Monty in Longmeadow and adds more medicinal planting to the herb garden, especially those that the bees love. Rachel also investigates how we can aid honey bee conservation and protect the nation's favourite pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don continues work in his courtyard, where he gives advice on plants which thrive on shady walls, sows root crops in the vegetable garden and catches up on work in his cottage garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets to work in the cutting garden, plants his tomatoes and brings pots of citrus out of the greenhouse and into the garden for the summer. Also, Carol Klein visits another of her gardening heroes, Penelope Hobhouse.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At the height of summer it's time to ensure that fruits and vegetables are given attention to ensure maximum cropping. Monty gives advice on the summer pruning of fruit trees as well as showing how to get the best from tomatoes and chillies. He also recommends plants which will carry on flowering into Autumn.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's thoughts turn to spring when he gives recommendations for bulbs to plant that will thrive in pots. He also shows how to prune summer fruiting raspberries. In Norfolk, Frances Tophill visits a gardener who at 97 still gardens every day.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the fourth of her films about botany, Carol Klein explores the inner workings of leaves - how they harness the sun's energy and turn it into food. Joe Swift meets Griff Rhys Jones for a private tour of his remarkable garden and discovers what a passionate gardener he is.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants for pollinators in the Wildlife Garden and trims his box topiary cones. He also takes succulent leaf cuttings and continues the summer veg harvest. Meanwhile, Carol Klein visits stunning Italian-influenced gardens in Gloucestershire.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty expands the planting on the mound, gathers self-sown seedlings and prepares for a summer display in the cottage garden. Meanwhile, Nick Bailey travels to Devon to explore a stunning garden that combines historic charm with modern garden design.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty is planting bulbs in pots and around the garden for an explosion of spring colour. Carol Klein travels to Yorkshire where she takes a close look at the enormous colour range and form of a late season perennial, the salvia. Mark Lane is in Oxfordshire looking at how ornamental grasses can be used in planting design to create exciting combinations.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn unfolds in the garden, Monty Don has plenty to be getting on with at Longmeadow. In his quest to track down some of the nations most remarkable allotments, Joe Swift visits a tropical paradise in Runcorn.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has tips and ideas for planting up garden pots to provide a focal point over the winter months, Rachel visits the tulips of Keukenhof, Joe visits Esther Rantzen's much-loved garden, and Carol visits Glebe Cottage.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn just around the corner, Adam takes stock of his garden and plans ahead for some late-season interest under the supervision of Ash the cat. Plus, Frances visits a garden in Kent where the plants provide a non-stop buffet for insects.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles some seasonal gardening jobs at Longmeadow and guest presenter Matthew Wilson has some ideas to brighten up a dark, north-facing wall.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: In the thrilling season finale of "Goin' Coastal," host Josh Calhoon takes his daughter, Lily, on an unforgettable birthday fishing adventure in Destin, Florida. They target mighty amberjack, battling these fierce fighters, when Lily hooks into a surprising Goliath grouper, leading to an epic showdown. This heartwarming and action-packed episode captures the essence of family, the thrill of the catch, and the beauty of coastal living. Don't miss this special finale filled with love, laughter, and coastal charm.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: In this episode of going coastal, Capt. Joshua Calhoon & Marcus Castro set out for epic Tarpon fishing. They got one boat side and then decided to go after giant mangrove snapper for hook & cook at Peppers!

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Nick visits the Crystal Coast of North Carolina to search out redfish and seatrout in the backwaters with Capt. Joe Tunstall and Capt. Chris Kimney.

programme.title: Saltwater Underground
programme.desc: Ike on Stripers Bassmaster legend Mike Iaconelli joins Nick in a wild time chasing down striped bass blitzes off the Jersey Coast, getting bent rods from the boat and surf.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Odyssea Sportfishing family grows as Casey Villone comes aboard as Rush's new deck hand. While Rush gained a helping hand on his charters, he also scored a new "Fishing Mate" who is always game to bend a rod. With a day off and a report of Tuna offshore, the two head out to see if they can beat the sharks and land a Key West sushi dinner.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush teams up with longtime friend and fellow angler Jesus Diaz for a well-earned "busman's holiday" in the beautiful waters of Key West. Even on a day off, these two can't resist seeing what's going to bite. Taking the wind and the tides into account, the duo maps out a strategic circuit through Key West's surrounding waters to target cobia, grouper, snapper, and tuna for a busy day "off" work.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Water quality is everythingand the Star brite - SeaSafe team is back at it for the second year in a row! Led by Cory Redwine, Conservation Director of Project SeaSafe, this is the 4th Annual Clean Water Collective and its bigger than ever. This time, were in Grant, Florida, where 4 million clams are being released into the Indian River Lagoon, paired with the planting of thousands of mangroves, oyster work by CCA and trash clean ups to help restore one of Floridas most critical ecosystems. But its not just about hard workits about connection. With local captains, fishing legends, and the Local Knowledge crew on hand, we hit the water to show why this place is worth fighting for. From clam drops by drone, to in-water mangrove planting, to monster snook catches, this is hands-on conservation at its best. This two-part series kicks off with action, heart, and the kind of hope only a healthy waterway can bring. Dont miss Part 1where conservation meets community and everyone gets their hands wet.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As part of this year's Star brite Sea Safe event, we hit the water to experience some of the incredible fishing the Indian River Lagoon has to offer. For Rush, that meant some serious bow time with close friend Alex Hughey - on the hunt for some of the biggest snook we've ever encountered. The bite wasn't easy, but that didn't stop Rush from smashing his personal best - not once, but twice - in one unforgettable day on the water. Don't miss this action-packed episode of the Sea Safe adventure from beautiful Sebastian, Florida!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Join Rush and his good friend Anthony Solmo for an epic day of fishing in the stunning waters of Key West, Florida! Leaving the Odyssea at the dock, they hop on a bay boat outfitted with a trolling motor for the ultimate inshore adventure. Gliding quietly through the shallows, they target a variety of speciesincluding hard-pulling Tarpon and explosive topwater Jacksleaving Rush thinking, A guy could get used to this kind of fishing!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: SoCal summer is calling, and the Local Knowledge crew is back on Alis home turf in San Diego, California. With reports of hot bites and fish moving in, the crew faces a classic Southern California dilemma chase big yellowtail around the Coronado Islands or head north in search of bluefin tuna. The options are plenty, the challenges are real, and thats exactly what keeps fishing in SoCal so exciting.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor run from Hawks Cay Resort up to Islamorada on a windy day to fish under the mangroves for Goliath grouper.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor join Captain Bryson Shaaber to fish the channels around Key West targeting big spring tarpon with live pinfish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head deep into the Everglades to target snook in the murky waters of Lake Ingraham.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor use Lowrance Active Target all day to find fish, first targeting bridge tarpon then finding a variety of species in Florida Bay mullet muds.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor chase Tarpon of all sizes around Florida Bay and the Everglades.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head to the iconic Seven Mile Bridge targeting big jack crevasses and permit.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss explores the spartina creeks of St. Augustine, with the hopes of Landing a N.E. Florida slam!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali & Rush are back on the West Coast joining forces with scientists chasing giant bluefin tuna.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: We kick off Season 2 in Tennessee where we stop in Nashville, Townsend, and Johnson City!!

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: We will take you on an incredible journey visiting the most iconic wrecks and reefs in this area of the Keys. And we will also explore the groundbreaking work that scientists and volunteers are working on to shade corals from the harsh sunlight and extreme ocean temperatures.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Similar to any good Cajun dish, a successful duck camp requires preparation. The last day on dry land is filled with essential stops to get ready for 5 days on the Bayou. Whether making sure we have the right ingredients for our favorite meals, or getting the boats brushed up and ready for action, the day before can be just as important as the day of.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela sets out to pursue, capture and aid in the conservation of the tallest land mammal in North America the Moose.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green explores the 10,000 islands off the West Coast of Florida on his Sea-Doo while trying to catch fish after red tide. If the idea of camping off the grid, only eating what you catch, and discovering remains of thousand-year-old civilizations excites you, this is an episode you won't want to miss.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: There is a place in Florida that not many people have heard about. The Forgotten Coast, Ever heard of it? Didnt think so. Lets discover it together.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: From battling towering 12-foot waves in the Gulf of Alaska, to reeling in colossal 200 lb. halibut, they discover firsthand the rugged beauty of America's 49th state. This episode highlights Lindell Yachts as a top builder of rugged offshore sportfishing yachts, as well as Radon Boats as great pilothouse fishing and guide boats.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: "Hope you're hungry. In this episode, come along as we eat our weight in sushi and ramen, meet nori farmers and wagyu ranchers, and make some new surfing buddies along the way. P.S. if you're hungry for more Japan content, stay tuned for our next two episodes.In this episode of DIRT, the crew road tripped around Kyushu. The food culture in Kyushu dates back to the emperors of Japan, and the Black Current off the eastern shore has shaped the island's cuisine for centuries. The DIRT team followed that current up the coastline, surfing with new friends and tasting new flavors. And with each stop, we learned even more about how the traditions we keep can honor thousands of years of knowledgeand point the way to the future."

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: Jay made it to Austin, Texas, the hill country hub for public water, hungry fish, and innovative anglers.

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: With Tampa Bay suffering from a tragic red tide, Court left his home waters to fish with Jay and Casey in our backyard, the flats of Indian River and Mosquito Lagoon.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: When Plan A and Plan B don't go as planned, Destin always has a way of bailing you out.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Craig Harrison and Rusty Smith from Caza Outdoors (Los Cazadores, Pnuma,Trophy Scan, Heated Core & more) hunt with the TTHA crew at the G2 Ranch in Pearsall, TX. Sharing a deer camp with friends is a time honored tradition across the country, and one that we hold near and dear to our hearts here at Texas Trophy Hunters!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Throughout the years, our friendships have been forged in deer camps across the country, and this week is a continuation of some of those times. This week, we have Dave Peterson and Mike Winkler from Do All Outdoors and Jurassic Rock in camp with us. When all is said and done, we even got to do a little hunting ourselves and create more memories that will last a lifetime

programme.title: On Deck
programme.desc: For someone like Capt. Cory who's out on the water most days of the year, it's easy to notice the little changes that show the stress on an ecosystem. Whether that's subtle movements of fish from lingering red tide blooms or large-scale impacts from high-volume Lak Okeechobee discharges, he sees it all, and he's ready for things to change. "I wish we would get to a point where we really put our foot down and do something about it before it's too late."Watch this episode to learn more about what's going on and to see why Capt. Cory is so passionate about fighting to protect the places he loves. Visit https://captainsforcleanwater.org to join the fight.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisianas only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his familys traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, hell meet plenty of farmers and foragersharvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiters Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryans family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiters pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryans passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike and Chi Lui they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies for trolling and reef fishing. The team reels in a variety of fish, including snapper, mackerel, porgy, blue fish. Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryans passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate outside in Palm Beach County FL.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for huntersand its been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, well celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: The mission of Shoot United is to be a content resource for millions of shooters and a place where people can learn, build confidence and find ways to participate. Through films, educational videos and articles, SU has impacted countless shooters all over the world. In this episode, join Shoot United Ambassadors as they inspire and educate through a series of instructional videos and stories in pistol, self-defense, trap and skeet and sporting clays. GUESTS: Thea Van Sync (Team Winchester) Callie Farill (Team Winchester) Becky Yackley (Team Winchester) Theo Ribbs (Team Winchester) Jessica Hook (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Illinois isnt the first state you think about when it comes to waterfowl, but the Wentz Brothers have dialed in some honey holes over the years. On this episode, a slew of waterfowl experts put to the test some of the newest Winchester waterfowl ammunition during the great migration of the Mississippi Flyway in early December. Well also head north to the shores of Kodiak Island, Alaska with Chris and Casey Keefer as they push the limits of Winchesters new Last Call Double Shot on fast-ripping sea ducks.GUESTS: Zach Wentz (Team Winchester) Nathan Robinson (Winchester Ammunition) Ryan Swaner (Winchester Repeating Arms) Chris Jennings (Ducks Unlimited) Mike Brasher (Ducks Unlimited) Scott Olmsted (American Hunter) Travis Hall (Field & Stream) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Col. Nick Nichols from Folds of Honor and Olympic skeet shooter Dania Vizzi are both proud Americans who have represented their country overseas. Col. Nichols commanded the air in the cockpit of a fighter jet for countless missions during his seven combat tours and Dania donned the stars and bars proudly on her shooting vest as an Olympian in Paris. Now with Winchesters in hand, both are in the Midwest whitetail woods during late November during the back end of the rut hoping to connect on a Missouri monarch.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials, John and Bert work to gut and re-foam the stingers in the classic 200 Aquasport project. John visits the experts at Marine Surplus to search for a new center console. Finally, we learn about new carpeting options on the classic Glastron project and get expert marine hardware tips.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team follows the project of a detailed retrofitting of a Bertram upgrading from one motor to twin engines with the help of an Armstrong Bracket. The team then heads to Boatwrench Inc. to rebuild the carburetor for the Glastron project.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade and the old Trained Assassins (TAT) crew head to Montrose, Colorado where they meet up with Slades dad, Bear Cub, TJ, and George for a heck of a week at Elk Camp. This is all going on now on Hunting Land Man TV.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Batter Batter Swing. Well, you might see where this might be headed. But, Hey!! Slade is in the great state of Kansas. Its mid-October and hes looking to bring home Lori some extra home dcor.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When the Bay Point Billfish Open returns, we hop on board the Ellie B for some offshore competition and follow the events epic dockside party.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin & Merediths beautiful Panama City Beach morning is met with a slack tide so a new path to redfish success is found under a popular bridge.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesnt come quickly or easily.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: After several years of shifting focus back to his native whitetails, Dahlke returns to mule deer country with the Muley Freak, Erik Van Woerkom. Follow along on this Utah mule deer hunt.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest its about the journey.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: For decades, Paul Butski has set the standard in turkey calling. His name is etched into the NWTF Grand National Calling Championships Hall of Fame, and his influence stretches far beyond the stage. He didnt just win competitions, he shaped the way we talk to turkeys and more importantly, the way we hunt them.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Todd Rogers embraces the business of being a hunting outfitter as a labor of love. And while so many family-run operations are dwindling in rural America, the Rogers legacy is here to stay. Will Cooper and Josh Dahlke return to western Oklahoma to share this story while pursuing brush-country whitetails in the red dirt.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his son take on the turkey woods for an afternoon hunt. Although the woods remained quiet, a tom soon snuck out of the woods and on the end of Bentley's barrel! After that Slade was able to help a client of his harvest his first turkey! And boy was it an action packed hunt! Jakes, hens, and tons of gobbles, This hunt is spectacular! Lastly, Slade introduces a property that we have already made a video on, but with just how amazing the land is, we had to include it! Floweree is the epitome of a sportsman's paradise!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode we take you behind the scenes of production for one of the biggest and baddest listings Slade has ever gotten - Southside Land Company in Jefferson County, MS. Hunter Phelps comes down from Kentucky to help film, and Slade puts him on 2 Mississippi gobblers.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike heads to the Lowcountry to rendezvous with good friend Capt. Ben Alderman.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike reunites with his South Seas comrade for a day of trout madness.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike heads to the back, back-country where even the fish struggle to find water.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: It's a trip out to God's Grocery Store with country star Styles Haury ashe and Brandon look for Tuna and Snapper to bring home to the family.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons is passionate about catching the mighty Sailfish, andgoes out with his tournament partner and former MLB star, Doug Mankietwicz. Doug has won a World Series and Olympic Gold medal, and now is in search of some Sails.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon takes outdoorsman Zac Yarbrough to look for blackfin tuna and then out deep for swordfish. They are joined by Styles Haury for some epic offshore action.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Renowned Kiteboarder Mike Walsh goes out on a windy day with Brandon to see what they can catch around the iconic lighthouses of the middle Keys.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: WoodHavens Josh Anderson heads to the Western Plains of Kansas in pursuit of a mature whitetail buck. Because of the wide open terrain, a decoy and blind calling can be very affective because of the visibility. After a few well-timed grunts on the Intimidator grunt call, a shooter buck shows up right at the base of the tree!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: After years of chasing one of the oldest and most elusive bucks he's ever encountered, Phillip Vanderpool uses the WoodHaven Initmidator grunt call to finally gets his shot at Tinman, a legendary 10.5-year-old buck in Kansas.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jacob Pentecost and Easton Thompson head to Illinois for the youth hunting season. With hot weather and slow deer movement, the hunt proves to be a challenge. After days of patience and persistence, Jacob finally gets the opportunity to fill his tag!

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Retired Army National Guard and Native American Darin Dimas details his and his familes life of patriotism while living on the reservation in beautiful Poplar Montana.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy has been playing cat and mouse with a buck called The Kansas 8 and after 2 encounters he is trying to seal the coffin on this big Missouri whitetail once and for all.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys are on the Raven in Missouri trying to plant 50 acres of Big Tine food plots in 5 days before heading out west to kick off the hunting season.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: In the wide world of western big game, pronghorn antelope hunting in Wyoming is unmatched in its accessibility and excitement. Its an active pursuit, typically ripe with plenty of opportunities to spot and stalk black-horned bucks. This makes it an ideal forum for riflemen looking to scratch their western itch.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Snapper and Grouper out in the Gulf of Mexico are waiting for Brandon Simmons and Eric Davis. They just have to ride the sporty chop to get to them.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Capt. Blair heads to Duck Key fishing with Capt. Drew Hall out of Hawks Cay Marina in search of deep water fish in the Atlantic.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Blair and Capt Chris Broome head to the back country of Marco Island to catch fish. Who knows what they'll catch.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Join Capt. Mike Anderson as he shows us the best of the best fishing hes experienced out of South Seas Island Resort

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord returns to PCB and joins Capt. Justin for one of his favorite way to fish -- sight fishing redfish on the beach. But its never easy when its breezy!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When the Bay Point Billfish Open returns, we hop on board the Ellie B for some offshore competition and follow the events epic dockside party.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: We kick off Season 2 in Tennessee where we stop in Nashville, Townsend, and Johnson City!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through the mountains of western North Carolina, where we stop in Asheville and Cashiers!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through Georgia, where we stop in Helen, Alpharetta and Atlanta!!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: This episode we make our way through South Carolina, where we stop in Clemson, Travelers Rest and Charleston!!

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: In the thrilling season finale of "Goin' Coastal," host Josh Calhoon takes his daughter, Lily, on an unforgettable birthday fishing adventure in Destin, Florida. They target mighty amberjack, battling these fierce fighters, when Lily hooks into a surprising Goliath grouper, leading to an epic showdown. This heartwarming and action-packed episode captures the essence of family, the thrill of the catch, and the beauty of coastal living. Don't miss this special finale filled with love, laughter, and coastal charm.

programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor join Captain Bryson Shaaber to fish the channels around Key West targeting big spring tarpon with live pinfish.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head deep into the Everglades to target snook in the murky waters of Lake Ingraham.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor use Lowrance Active Target all day to find fish, first targeting bridge tarpon then finding a variety of species in Florida Bay mullet muds.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor chase Tarpon of all sizes around Florida Bay and the Everglades.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head to the iconic Seven Mile Bridge targeting big jack crevasses and permit.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss explores the spartina creeks of St. Augustine, with the hopes of Landing a N.E. Florida slam!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Ali & Rush are back on the West Coast joining forces with scientists chasing giant bluefin tuna.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: We kick off Season 2 in Tennessee where we stop in Nashville, Townsend, and Johnson City!!

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: We will take you on an incredible journey visiting the most iconic wrecks and reefs in this area of the Keys. And we will also explore the groundbreaking work that scientists and volunteers are working on to shade corals from the harsh sunlight and extreme ocean temperatures.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Similar to any good Cajun dish, a successful duck camp requires preparation. The last day on dry land is filled with essential stops to get ready for 5 days on the Bayou. Whether making sure we have the right ingredients for our favorite meals, or getting the boats brushed up and ready for action, the day before can be just as important as the day of.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela sets out to pursue, capture and aid in the conservation of the tallest land mammal in North America the Moose.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green explores the 10,000 islands off the West Coast of Florida on his Sea-Doo while trying to catch fish after red tide. If the idea of camping off the grid, only eating what you catch, and discovering remains of thousand-year-old civilizations excites you, this is an episode you won't want to miss.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: There is a place in Florida that not many people have heard about. The Forgotten Coast, Ever heard of it? Didnt think so. Lets discover it together.

programme.title: Stomping Grounds
programme.desc: From battling towering 12-foot waves in the Gulf of Alaska, to reeling in colossal 200 lb. halibut, they discover firsthand the rugged beauty of America's 49th state. This episode highlights Lindell Yachts as a top builder of rugged offshore sportfishing yachts, as well as Radon Boats as great pilothouse fishing and guide boats.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: "Hope you're hungry. In this episode, come along as we eat our weight in sushi and ramen, meet nori farmers and wagyu ranchers, and make some new surfing buddies along the way. P.S. if you're hungry for more Japan content, stay tuned for our next two episodes.In this episode of DIRT, the crew road tripped around Kyushu. The food culture in Kyushu dates back to the emperors of Japan, and the Black Current off the eastern shore has shaped the island's cuisine for centuries. The DIRT team followed that current up the coastline, surfing with new friends and tasting new flavors. And with each stop, we learned even more about how the traditions we keep can honor thousands of years of knowledgeand point the way to the future."

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: Jay made it to Austin, Texas, the hill country hub for public water, hungry fish, and innovative anglers.

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: With Tampa Bay suffering from a tragic red tide, Court left his home waters to fish with Jay and Casey in our backyard, the flats of Indian River and Mosquito Lagoon.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: When Plan A and Plan B don't go as planned, Destin always has a way of bailing you out.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Craig Harrison and Rusty Smith from Caza Outdoors (Los Cazadores, Pnuma,Trophy Scan, Heated Core & more) hunt with the TTHA crew at the G2 Ranch in Pearsall, TX. Sharing a deer camp with friends is a time honored tradition across the country, and one that we hold near and dear to our hearts here at Texas Trophy Hunters!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Throughout the years, our friendships have been forged in deer camps across the country, and this week is a continuation of some of those times. This week, we have Dave Peterson and Mike Winkler from Do All Outdoors and Jurassic Rock in camp with us. When all is said and done, we even got to do a little hunting ourselves and create more memories that will last a lifetime

programme.title: On Deck
programme.desc: For someone like Capt. Cory who's out on the water most days of the year, it's easy to notice the little changes that show the stress on an ecosystem. Whether that's subtle movements of fish from lingering red tide blooms or large-scale impacts from high-volume Lak Okeechobee discharges, he sees it all, and he's ready for things to change. "I wish we would get to a point where we really put our foot down and do something about it before it's too late."Watch this episode to learn more about what's going on and to see why Capt. Cory is so passionate about fighting to protect the places he loves. Visit https://captainsforcleanwater.org to join the fight.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisianas only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his familys traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, hell meet plenty of farmers and foragersharvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiters Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryans family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiters pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 5 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike, they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies, reeling in a variety of catches, including bonita and a stunning mahi mahi. The duo shares insights into their fishing setup, explains the use of daisy chains, and celebrates their exciting day at sea. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryans passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with a reflection on the beauty and bounty of Palm Beach County waters.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 3 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller joins Captain Alex from Supremacy Fishing Charters for an offshore adventure targeting big fish off shore. Starting at the Palm Beach Inlet, the team uses planar fishing techniques to hook wahoo and other catches like kingfish and amberjack. Along the way, firefighter Johnny Bennett shares his journey from fishing to starting a popular fish dip business. The day wraps up with thrilling doubleheader catches and a conservation message, showcasing the importance of sustainable fishing practices.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike and Chi Lui they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies for trolling and reef fishing. The team reels in a variety of fish, including snapper, mackerel, porgy, blue fish. Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryans passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate outside in Palm Beach County FL.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for huntersand its been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, well celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: The mission of Shoot United is to be a content resource for millions of shooters and a place where people can learn, build confidence and find ways to participate. Through films, educational videos and articles, SU has impacted countless shooters all over the world. In this episode, join Shoot United Ambassadors as they inspire and educate through a series of instructional videos and stories in pistol, self-defense, trap and skeet and sporting clays. GUESTS: Thea Van Sync (Team Winchester) Callie Farill (Team Winchester) Becky Yackley (Team Winchester) Theo Ribbs (Team Winchester) Jessica Hook (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Illinois isnt the first state you think about when it comes to waterfowl, but the Wentz Brothers have dialed in some honey holes over the years. On this episode, a slew of waterfowl experts put to the test some of the newest Winchester waterfowl ammunition during the great migration of the Mississippi Flyway in early December. Well also head north to the shores of Kodiak Island, Alaska with Chris and Casey Keefer as they push the limits of Winchesters new Last Call Double Shot on fast-ripping sea ducks.GUESTS: Zach Wentz (Team Winchester) Nathan Robinson (Winchester Ammunition) Ryan Swaner (Winchester Repeating Arms) Chris Jennings (Ducks Unlimited) Mike Brasher (Ducks Unlimited) Scott Olmsted (American Hunter) Travis Hall (Field & Stream) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Col. Nick Nichols from Folds of Honor and Olympic skeet shooter Dania Vizzi are both proud Americans who have represented their country overseas. Col. Nichols commanded the air in the cockpit of a fighter jet for countless missions during his seven combat tours and Dania donned the stars and bars proudly on her shooting vest as an Olympian in Paris. Now with Winchesters in hand, both are in the Midwest whitetail woods during late November during the back end of the rut hoping to connect on a Missouri monarch.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials, John and Bert work to gut and re-foam the stingers in the classic 200 Aquasport project. John visits the experts at Marine Surplus to search for a new center console. Finally, we learn about new carpeting options on the classic Glastron project and get expert marine hardware tips.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team follows the project of a detailed retrofitting of a Bertram upgrading from one motor to twin engines with the help of an Armstrong Bracket. The team then heads to Boatwrench Inc. to rebuild the carburetor for the Glastron project.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade and the old Trained Assassins (TAT) crew head to Montrose, Colorado where they meet up with Slades dad, Bear Cub, TJ, and George for a heck of a week at Elk Camp. This is all going on now on Hunting Land Man TV.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Batter Batter Swing. Well, you might see where this might be headed. But, Hey!! Slade is in the great state of Kansas. Its mid-October and hes looking to bring home Lori some extra home dcor.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When the Bay Point Billfish Open returns, we hop on board the Ellie B for some offshore competition and follow the events epic dockside party.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin & Merediths beautiful Panama City Beach morning is met with a slack tide so a new path to redfish success is found under a popular bridge.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesnt come quickly or easily.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: After several years of shifting focus back to his native whitetails, Dahlke returns to mule deer country with the Muley Freak, Erik Van Woerkom. Follow along on this Utah mule deer hunt.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest its about the journey.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: For decades, Paul Butski has set the standard in turkey calling. His name is etched into the NWTF Grand National Calling Championships Hall of Fame, and his influence stretches far beyond the stage. He didnt just win competitions, he shaped the way we talk to turkeys and more importantly, the way we hunt them.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Todd Rogers embraces the business of being a hunting outfitter as a labor of love. And while so many family-run operations are dwindling in rural America, the Rogers legacy is here to stay. Will Cooper and Josh Dahlke return to western Oklahoma to share this story while pursuing brush-country whitetails in the red dirt.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Opening day in Mississippi has arrived and Slade is taking full advantage of it! With the weather not cooperating Slade and Zeb stumble into a turkey hunt they won't soon forget. Two days later, the hot streak continues with Slade connecting on another turkey on an 83 acre property he has for sale! Also, Slade gives some tips and his ideas on small acreage hunting, and how it can be just as lucrative as big tracks of land!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and his son take on the turkey woods for an afternoon hunt. Although the woods remained quiet, a tom soon snuck out of the woods and on the end of Bentley's barrel! After that Slade was able to help a client of his harvest his first turkey! And boy was it an action packed hunt! Jakes, hens, and tons of gobbles, This hunt is spectacular! Lastly, Slade introduces a property that we have already made a video on, but with just how amazing the land is, we had to include it! Floweree is the epitome of a sportsman's paradise!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode we take you behind the scenes of production for one of the biggest and baddest listings Slade has ever gotten - Southside Land Company in Jefferson County, MS. Hunter Phelps comes down from Kentucky to help film, and Slade puts him on 2 Mississippi gobblers.

programme.desc: Brandon takes outdoorsman Zac Yarbrough to look for blackfin tuna and then out deep for swordfish. They are joined by Styles Haury for some epic offshore action.

programme.desc: WoodHavens Josh Anderson heads to the Western Plains of Kansas in pursuit of a mature whitetail buck. programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: After years of chasing one of the oldest and most elusive bucks he's ever encountered, Phillip Vanderpool uses the WoodHaven Initmidator grunt call to finally gets his shot at Tinman, a legendary 10.5-year-old buck in Kansas.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jacob Pentecost and Easton Thompson head to Illinois for the youth hunting season. With hot weather and slow deer movement, the hunt proves to be a challenge. After days of patience and persistence, Jacob finally gets the opportunity to fill his tag!

programme.desc: On their way home for the holidays, two college students break down on a deserted road and are preyed upon by the ghosts of people who died there.

programme.title: The Lazarus Project
programme.desc: A reformed thief is drawn back into a burglary-gone-wrong that lands him on death row, until he mysteriously wakes up in a psychiatric hospital.
