programme.title: 7 Seconds
programme.desc: Wesley Snipes stars as a skilled art thief who has to come up with a rescue plan when his partner is kidnapped in retaliation for their crimes.

programme.title: The Take
programme.desc: When Felix finds himself in the middle of a carefully orchestrated heist, he takes it upon himself to find the real perpetrators and clear his name.

programme.title: Silverado
programme.desc: In the 1800s Old West, an unlikely band of misfit friends teams up in a shoot-em-up against a frontier towns crooked sheriff and his henchmen.

programme.title: Cowboy Up
programme.desc: Follow the tumultuous life of two brothers, Ely, a rising rodeo star, and Hank, a rodeo clown, as they make their way through the bull riding circuit.

programme.title: Suspect
programme.desc: Kathleen is an overworked public defender who needs a vacation. Instead, she is given another case with no ordinary crime and no ordinary criminal.

programme.title: Final Descent
programme.desc: When his aircraft collides with another plane in midair, Captain Glen "Lucky" Singer must try to save the lives of his 319 passengers.

programme.title: Final Run
programme.desc: On a family trip, Glen "Lucky" Singer must stop a train from careening toward disaster when an engineer's mistake causes a glitch in the controls.

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: A vacationing couple gets embroiled in a game of cat-and-mouse with Bermuda gangsters after discovering a cache of drugs stashed inside a sunken ship.

programme.title: Relative Chaos
programme.desc: Dil and his girlfriend, Katherine, attempt to end his 25-year losing streak in the annual Gilbert Cup, a fiercely competitive family tradition.

programme.title: Wrongfully Accused
programme.desc: Ryan Harrison is framed for murder and must prove himself innocent by finding a mysterious one-eyed, one-armed, one-legged man before it is too late.

programme.title: The Master of Disguise
programme.desc: A waiter at his fathers Italian restaurant possesses an inherited talent for mimicry and learns how to use it to take on multiple identities.

programme.title: The Pest
programme.desc: A manic con man finds himself the prey of a high-speed hunt that migrates from a neo-Nazi's private island to the streets of Miami's South Beach.

programme.title: The Throwaways
programme.desc: After a shrewd hacker is captured by the CIA, he agrees to work with them as long as he gets to pick the members of his ragtag team.

programme.title: Nadine
programme.desc: While recovering sexy photos of herself from a dishonest photographer, a woman witnesses a murder and finds herself at the center of a conspiracy.

programme.title: The War Lover
programme.desc: In England during World War II, a pair of bomber pilots fall for the same woman but only one will make it through the conflict to ask for her hand.

programme.title: Port Afrique
programme.desc: An American (Phil Carey) returns to Morocco and discovers his wife's past while probing her death.

programme.title: Operation Mad Ball
programme.desc: A group of enlisted men, led by Private Hogan, are tasked with planning a dance party, while trying to keep it a secret from a busy-body officer.

programme.title: The Ambushers
programme.desc: When an experimental flying saucer is brought down in Mexico, secret agent Matt Helm is sent to find it and keep it from falling into enemy hands.

programme.title: No Sad Songs for Me
programme.desc: Upon being diagnosed with terminal cancer, selfless suburban housewife Mary Scott (Margaret Sullavan) makes the ultimate sacrifice: she decides to keep the unpleasant news from her husband, Brad (Wendell Corey), and daughter, Polly, to avoid devastating her loved ones. Instead, Mary encourages Brad's affair with a co-worker (Viveca Lindfors), and even grooms the other woman to take her place. But as Mary's illness progresses, keeping it a secret presents a considerable challenge.

programme.title: The Long Gray Line
programme.desc: An Irish immigrant who found a home in the Army as a West Point instructor becomes very close to his pupils, one of whom is Dwight Eisenhower.

programme.title: The Three Stooges in Orbit
programme.desc: When a pair of Martians steal a powerful submarine-tank-rocket military weapon from an inventor, the Three Stooges step in to try to save the day.

programme.title: Gidget Grows Up
programme.desc: When her boyfriend leaves for the Air Force without calling, Gidget heads to New York in the name of world peace and joins the U.N. as a tour guide.

programme.title: Miss Grant Takes Richmond
programme.desc: A bookie operating behind a real estate front gets pulled into the business for real when he hires a daffy secretary who thinks the office is legit.

programme.title: Bell, Book and Candle
programme.desc: A Greenwich Village witch falls for her dashing neighbor. When she learns hes engaged, she casts a love spell but risks losing her powers for good.

programme.title: First Comes Courage
programme.desc: Beautiful Norwegian woman Nicole Larsen (Merle Oberon) is dedicated to the local resistance movement, and seduces Nazi officer Paul Dichter (Carl Esmond) in order to gain information that will help to defeat the Germans. Complicating matters for Nicole are both the difficulty of her loathsome undercover work and the appearance of an old flame, handsome English soldier Allan Lowell (Brian Aherne), who would like nothing more than to reunite with her.

programme.title: Pushover
programme.desc: To get the lowdown on stolen cash, a duty-bound cop makes a move on the girlfriend of a murderous bank robber and accidentally falls for her.

programme.title: The Bedford Incident
programme.desc: Reporter Ben Munceford (Sidney Poitier) is aboard a U.S. Navy ship sailing near the Arctic Circle, on assignment to write a profile of Capt. Eric Finlander (Richard Widmark), a hardened anti-communist. Despite the concerns of Munceford, medical officer Chester Potter (Martin Balsam) and others on the ship, Finlander is shadowing a Soviet submarine on patrol in the same area, hoping to make it to surface. The cat-and-mouse game, however, turns deadly serious.

programme.title: The Fuller Brush Girl
programme.desc: Fired from her job as a switchboard operator, a daffy young woman tries her hand at door-to-door cosmetics sales only to get mixed up in a murder rap.

programme.title: The Collector
programme.desc: A meek bank clerk and butterfly collector becomes increasingly obsessed with an art student who hes determined to make fall in love with him.

programme.title: The Mating of Millie
programme.desc: A businesswoman (Evelyn Keyes) asks a bachelor (Glenn Ford) to help her find a husband so she can adopt an orphan.

programme.title: Murderer's Row
programme.desc: Secret agent Matt Helm must rescue the kidnapped inventor of an ultra-destructive "helio beam" capable of destroying Washington, D.C.

programme.title: The Whole Town's Talking
programme.desc: Clerk Arthur Jones (Edward G. Robinson) lives a dull life until someone realizes that he looks like gangster "Killer" Mannion (also Robinson). After Jones is brought in by the police and his identity is verified, he is given a note to assuage any other suspicious policeman. Jones is hired by a newspaper to write about Mannion and starts dating Wilhelmina Clark (Jean Arthur). However, when Jones returns home one night, Mannion is waiting and demands the note so that he can roam freely.

programme.title: The Magic Carpet
programme.desc: When his parents, the caliph and queen, are murdered by usurper Ali (Gregory Gaye), the newborn Ramoth is delivered to the safety of his uncle, Ahkmid (William Fawcett), via a magic carpet. The adult Ramoth (John Agar) becomes masked hero the Scarlet Falcon. After tricking the reigning caliph into appointing him the royal physician, Ramoth learns of his noble birth and, with the help of faithful Razi (George Tobias) and beautiful Lida (Patricia Medina), he fights Ali and his wrathful minions.

programme.title: The Notorious Landlady
programme.desc: After falling for his charming landlady, an American diplomat in London learns that she's suspected of murder and tries to help her clear her name.

programme.title: Lust for Gold
programme.desc: During the 1870s, the ruthless Jacob Walz (Glenn Ford) becomes very wealthy after locating a legendary Arizona gold mine and securing sole ownership by murdering his partner. Walz then travels to Phoenix, where he catches the attention of a beautiful and crafty woman named Julia Thomas (Ida Lupino), who has learned of his exploits. Eventually, Walz falls in love with Julia, unaware that she's already married to Pete (Gig Young), who is eyeing his fortune.

programme.title: Mackenna's Gold
programme.desc: Apaches, townsfolk, a Mexican bandit (Omar Sharif) and the cavalry follow a sheriff (Gregory Peck) to a mythical canyon of gold.

programme.title: Land Raiders
programme.desc: An Arizona land-grabber (Telly Savalas) and his brother (George Maharis) renew their feud amid Army troops and Apaches.

programme.title: Laramie
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) tries to stop an Army scout and a band of outlaws from starting an American Indian war.

programme.title: Pecos River
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) and his singing sidekick (Smiley Burnette) catch mail robbers.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders
programme.desc: Two brothers return home after the Civil War to find that their family has been kidnapped by a marauding band of rebel Confederate guerrillas.

programme.title: Utah Blaine
programme.desc: A gunfighter helps a ranch owner in his attempt to prevent a renegade crew from taking over the territory.

programme.title: The Man From Laramie
programme.desc: Will Lockhart (James Stewart) comes to the ranch town of Coronado looking for the man who is selling rifles to the Apaches, because his brother was killed with one. There he runs into Alec Waggoman (Donald Crisp), an aging rancher with a violent son named Dave (Alex Nicol). A conflict between Dave and Vic (Arthur Kennedy), Waggoman's top aid, helps Lockhart uncover the source of the rifles -- and also gets him involved in the power struggles at the Waggoman ranch.

programme.title: Renegades
programme.desc: Hannah Brockway (Evelyn Keyes) has a perfect fianc in Dr. Sam Martin (Willard Parker). Sam, who is respected by Hannah's family, is a noble man who cares for her and can make a good living in their frontier town. Yet Hannah craves adventure and finds it when she meets dashing Ben Dembrow (Larry Parks), the youngest of a notorious crime family. Together Ben and Hannah set off to forge a new life, but prejudice and strangling family ties soon bring trouble to these newlyweds.

programme.title: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Jed Cooper (Victor Mature), a trapper, enlists as an army fort scout, and shortly after meets and falls for Corinna Marston (Anne Bancroft), the wife of a nearby fort's commander. Jed comes across her husband, Col. Marston (Robert Preston), after he's suffered an attack at the hands of Native Americans. Col. Marston forces the captain of Jed's fort, Glenn Riordan (Guy Madison), to send out Jed and the troops to fight his attackers, despite their lack of battle experience.

programme.title: Relentless
programme.desc: Framed for a murder he didn't commit, a cowboy hides with a traveling woman as he flees a sheriff and hunts for the real killer.

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: The conniving Ed Barker (Dick Curtis) murders a rancher and tries to steal the ranch from his widow, Jean Andrews (Ann Doran). However, their old friend Cliff Houston (Charles Starrett) appears on the scene to try and save the day. He makes a deal with Barker and his crew to drive the Andrews herd to market and split the money, but each man really plans to con the other as soon as the time is right. Along for the ride is singing cowboy Bob Stevens (Bob Nolan).

programme.title: Massacre Canyon
programme.desc: A cavalry officer and two of his men set out to make sure that a shipment of guns safely reaches its destination.

programme.title: The Stranger Wore a Gun
programme.desc: After the Civil War, a spy for the Confederacy absconds to Arizona to start a new life but gets reluctantly pulled into a stagecoach gold robbery.

programme.title: Man in the Saddle
programme.desc: A wounded rancher (Randolph Scott) hides with a schoolmarm (Ellen Drew) after his ex-girlfriend's husband (Alexander Knox) runs him out of town.

programme.title: The Quick Gun
programme.desc: A banished gunfighter (Audie Murphy) returns to his sweetheart (Merry Anders) and helps his sheriff friend (James Best) face outlaws.

programme.title: Hollywood Round-Up
programme.desc: Kindly, fading star Carol Stevens (Helen Twelvetrees) accepts a role in a two-bit Western movie and arrives for an on-location shoot in a small town. When Stevens has words with her pompous co-star, Grant Drexel (Grant Withers), Drexel's stuntman, Buck Kennedy (Buck Jones), steps in to defend her. Kennedy's honorable gesture costs him his job. After a group of gangsters posing as a film crew frames the newly unemployed Kennedy for the robbery of a local bank, he must struggle to clear his name.

programme.title: The Great Sioux Massacre
programme.desc: The story of Gen. Custer (Philip Carey) and the Little Bighorn is seen through the eyes of two of his subordinates (Joseph Cotten, Darren McGavin).

programme.title: The Gun That Won the West
programme.desc: Superior Springfield rifles help scouts (Dennis Morgan, Richard Denning) and the cavalry get forts built in Wyoming.

programme.title: Ten Wanted Men
programme.desc: Rancher John Stewart (Randolph Scott) prefers to to resolve problems without falling back on violent solutions. However, fellow cattleman Wick Campbell (Richard Boone) isn't so peaceful, and he hires a team of armed mercenaries, led by ruthless Frank Scavo (Leo Gordon), to rid him of any possible competition. After narrowly surviving an attack from Scavo and his men, Stewart has little choice but to fight back in order to save both his ranch and his family, including nephew Howie (Skip Homeier).

programme.title: The Nebraskan
programme.desc: When his Indian assistant, Wingfoot (Maurice Jara), is accused of murdering a Sioux chief, Army scout Wade Harper (Phil Carey) brings him to Fort Kearney, Neb., where Colonel Markham (Regis Toomey) insists the young man has the right to a fair trial rather than handing him over to the Sioux. While in jail, Wingfoot is forced to escape with ruthless prisoner Reno Benton (Lee Van Cleef). Wade sets out with a small party to rescue his friend, with the Sioux right behind him.

programme.title: The Fighting Frontiersman
programme.desc: A Texas Ranger learns that the prospector who found Santa Ana's treasure has been captured by gold thieves.

programme.title: They Rode West
programme.desc: Dr. Allen Seward (Robert Francis) is the new doctor at a remote Army outpost. His liberal attitudes towards Native Americans become a source of tension between him and his superiors, especially Capt. Peter Blake (Philip Carey), who regards all Native Americans as dangerous and untrustworthy. Seward's insistence on treating several local Kiowa tribespeople for malaria further enrages Blake, who deems Seward a traitor when the Kiowa join forces with the Comanches and attack the fort.

programme.title: Mutiny on the Bounty (1962)
programme.desc: Marlon Brando stars as a first mate who leads his ship's exploited and abused crew through mutiny.

programme.title: Without Reservations
programme.desc: A writer falls for the perfect match for the hero of her latest novel.

programme.title: The Thin Man
programme.desc: Nick, Nora and their terrier somehow always seem to crack their case.

programme.title: Bringing Up Baby
programme.desc: Paleontologist David Huxley loses his fossil, his fiance and his freedom.

programme.title: Roberta
programme.desc: A football player inherits a chic Paris fashion house.

programme.title: Wild Rovers
programme.desc: Cowboy Ross Bodine decides to join his buddy in robbing a bank to finance a comfortable retirement.

programme.title: A Streetcar Named Desire
programme.desc: Family tensions boil over when a lonely and fragile Southern belle moves into her sister and brutish brother-in-law's run-down New Orleans home.

programme.title: Ocean's Eleven (1960)
programme.desc: Eleven pals prepare to rob five Las Vegas casinos on New Year's Eve.

programme.title: Bullitt
programme.desc: Featuring one of the most famous car chases in film history, a San Francisco detective follows a trail of lies after a witness is killed on his watch.

programme.title: Thirty Seconds Over Tokyo
programme.desc: After the devastating attack on Pearl Harbor, Lieutenant Colonel Jimmy Doolittle devises a plan for a daring raid to strike Japan.

programme.title: The Belle of New York
programme.desc: A turn-of-the-century playboy courts a Salvation Army girl.

programme.title: Up the Sandbox
programme.desc: A repressed housewife fantasizes about the life she could be living.

programme.title: What's Up, Doc?
programme.desc: When suitcases are mixed up, a chase across San Francisco follows.

programme.title: Knute Rockne All American
programme.desc: Biography of the Notre Dame coach's fight to "win one for the Gipper."

programme.title: Jim Thorpe: All American
programme.desc: The famous athlete fights prejudice in his pursuit of sports stardom.

programme.title: Take Me Out to the Ball Game
programme.desc: A beautiful woman takes over a turn-of-the-century baseball team.

programme.title: Meet Me in St. Louis
programme.desc: Judy Garland's 1944 musical dramatizes turn-of-the-century family life.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The village of Midsomer Mallow is one of the villages hoping to win the title of the "Perfect English Village" competition. As the story unfolds, not everything is "perfect" as local thief Peter Drinkwater is stabbed with a pitchfork at an abandoned farm, he's using as a squat. Shortly after robbing a retired actor's home. Despite the villagers' best efforts to keep the murder quiet so as to not ruin their chances in the competition, several further deaths occur eventually bringing Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby back several decades to uncover the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Whilst the Upper Marshwood hunt assemble outside the village inn, a filthy tramp-like man leaves the shop and skulks into the wood. Soon after, he hears the sound of the hunt begin and the unforgettable noise of the horses and hounds in hot pursuit of the fox. Running for cover, towards the safety of his home-made shelter, he stumbles and falls into a pit - screaming. LIZA, isolated in the disused railway carriage which constitutes her home, moves deeper into the wood having heard the scream. She finds the pit and sees the tramp lying crumpled on the ground, clearly dead. She stares at him for a moment, then turns and walks away.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers race to stay one step ahead of a storm approaching the Oregon coast; Jesse pushes his crew to meet their deadline; muddy roads trap Stump Branch trucks; Robby battles for control; lumber market slump.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Some crews shut down while others struggle to stay afloat after stormy weather arrives with a vengeance; the stalled housing market hits home for the loggers.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The news of upcoming layoffs worries the men; Gustafson Logging tries to get back on track; Browning races to meet a big deadline; Pihl Logging is under pressure to finish its Pig Farm job.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Jason Rygaard fights the weather while hauling heavy, slick trees on the steepest setting of the season; Danny Pihl and his veteran crew precisely drop 250-foot, old-growth cedars next to a group of cabins.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Jason Rygaard races to clear a hillside in time to fill four logging trucks; Jay R Harkness fights to control the untethered Tigercat on a steep, snow-covered mountainside; Bucking Billy and his son Hogan battle a forest of hang-ups and widow-makers.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Four companies of loggers risk their lives to chop down timber while dealing with mechanical failures, brutal weather and rugged terrain in the Pacific Northwest.

programme.desc: J.M. Browning strives to meet a big deadline; Stump Branch Logging tempts fate by jury-rigging old equipment; Gustafson races the weather to build an access road; Pihl Logging hauls in the forest's cash crop.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Two of Oregon's logging giants, J.M. Browning and Gustafson Logging, fight to survive; Jay Browning must make tough decisions; smaller outfits find winning strategies.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The gap widens between winners and losers at the halfway point of the season; Stump Branch tests a dangerous logging strategy; the Pihl men play while the bosses are away; a mistake by the Gustafson crew may end a man's career.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers barely survive in a plummeting market; the Gustafson bosses have a close call; an old hook-tender returns to the Browning team, halting Jesse's rise to management; Pihl loses a crucial member of the team.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Some loggers have more reasons to be grateful than do others as Thanksgiving arrives; the Pihl crew loses men to illness; the Gustafson crew's younger members blow off steam; the season's first snowfall bodes a warning for the Stump Branch crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Gustafson crew faces a nearly impossible deadline; half the Pihl crew skips work; Stump Branch mistakes and inexperience put profits and lives at risk; Jay Browning makes a troubling discovery about his next job.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The worst storm in 25 years pummels the Oregon coast, turning the town of Veronica into a flooded disaster area; Jay Browning is nowhere to be found; Darrell must act fast to save his house from falling trees.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers try to put the storm behind them and get back to work; Darrell makes a startling discovery; Stump Branch greenhorn Michael goes missing; Jay struggles to muster his troops without phone service; the Pihl crew bails out one of its own.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers blow into Santa Ana, CA. Barry Weiss climbs aboard the buying express. Dave Hester may have trouble leaving the station. And one buyer finds something that's got magic.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy kidnaps Pops and takes him to Rosamond, where they deftly score a fine locker; Kenny sets out to brighten everyone's day and his clowning around has him seeing stars; Lisa proves she has a friend... for now.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: This time in Montebello, Rene goes head-to-head with Darrell, buying the sister unit to see if he can finally unseat the king; Lisa and her dog sneak their way into a locker that earns her stamp of approval.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Huntington Beach, Calif., Darrell's insider information amplifies his investment considerably; Mary's find cooks up some oversized accoutrements; Kenny takes advantage of others' missteps to grab a unit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry arrives code 3 to Stanton, where he takes on a new disciple; Lisa gets clinical with her find, forcing her to take a closer look; the new guy pays heavily for a unit, but seems to know what he's doing, while Brandi and Rene struggle.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi wakes up on the wrong side of the bed but makes the best of it in Fullerton; Ivy snipes one locker and grabs a second, knocking out the competition.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The King of Montebello can't wait to see what he can drum up this time around; Rene sniffs out a great locker, stepping over the competition to get it; Kenny does his best to fire up his profits; Brandi can't see the potential in the units.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene steals the units in Rancho Palos Verdes, Calif.; Mary's locker reveals a sticky past; Justin demonstrates he can turn a small investment into a big return.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Kenny treats Perris, Calif., like a European vacation, picking up women along the way; Jarrod's lousy locker doesn't offer him any protection; Rene's tools end up being older than he expects.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell has a completely groovy time in Van Nuys, Calif.; Ivy starts his day off with an unwelcome bang; Brandi and Jarrod are left wondering whether their unit will bring clear skies or clouds ahead.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Kenny tiptoes down memory lane in Orange, Calif.; Brandi and Jarrod get to work on a tool locker; Darrell and his granddaughter dig up a creepy find.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy is on the warpath in Lancaster, doing his best to intimidate the other buyers, and he won't be losing any sleep over it; Brandi begrudgingly lets Bozek decide which locker they buy; Dusty goes up against the King to prove a point.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi does everything she can to stay positive; Darrell finds a unit with some vintage totes, while Gunter plays on Rene's last nerve.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie buys a 3D printer for the office that starts off as a fun distraction for the guys until it appears the printer could soon replace their jobs. Si, upset that Willie invested in the 3D printer and didn't give him a raise, invests in John Luke's Sno­Cone stand.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase, Jep, Si and Cole try to fight back a growing population of cottonmouth snakes on Phil's property. Meanwhile, Willie uses his business expertise to help Rebecca improve her clothing store.

programme.desc: Jase's hopes to win the inaugural Duck Commander Fishing Tournament is buoyed when he is able to enlist the help of legendary angler Bill Dance. Meanwhile, Willie's vanity over his greying beard leads him to make a questionable decision.

programme.desc: Jase and Jep make a deal with Mia and Merritt to get them to go dove hunting with them. Si tries to make some extra cash by starting a West Monroe tour.

programme.desc: Jumping Asian carp have invaded Monroe's waters so Jase and the guys set out to try to stop them from spreading further. Meanwhile, Willie and Si have to run Willie's Duck Diner for the day.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: With a long record of violence and abuse and weighing in at over 200lbs, Dog's target for the day does not sound like a gentle giant. When the trail grows cold Dog turns up the heat on the fugitive's brother and sister.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Leland has to attend a Lamaze class before he can join the hunt--another Chapman is on the way! But when Dog starts to go after this accused jewelry thief without his fastest son, he learns that this fugitive puts the "R" in runner.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A fugitive with a long criminal record has fled to Hawaii, and the bondsman on the mainland has asked Dog and the Posse for help. Dog doesn't have much information to work with, but he can use the felon's desire to impress his friends to track him down.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and company head to the Big Island in pursuit of two courthouse no-shows only to find that one of them appears to be posting status updates from Southern California.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has only a few days to catch a woman nicknamed Cats or forfeit Beth's $10,000 bond. But it won't be easy - Cats is eight months pregnant, so Dog will have to lure her in rather than risk a violent grab.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Beth buys Dog a shirt with an embroidered chicken that looks like a dragon, but Dog explains he only wears shirts with pictures of either Jesus or a Harley-Davidson. When it's time to go to work, the team goes after Necia.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Beth designs a luxurious new office for the team and shows it off to Dog, but the bounty hunter is more interested in starting his hunt for Federico, who's been revoked for missing court dates and generally running amuck.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Colorado bondsman Bobby Brown's got trouble and his name is Jackson. Weighing in at over 240lbs and standing six foot tall this bad boy has skipped out on a $10,000 bond.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A Hawaiian surfing hero is on a wave to nowhere and it's Dog's turn to play lifeguard. "Buttons," known throughout the islands for his prowess on the waves and his daring 360's, has wiped-out on the rocky shoals of drug addiction.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team are back in Colorado hunting bounties. Today's fugitive has a long rap sheet and a reputation for packing heat. With nothing but an address and phone number, the team heads out on the hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Both brother Tim and fellow Honolulu bondsman James need Dog's help to track down their hard to find fugitives. The two cases on the docket today are challenging, especially the hunt for Gregory, a felon with a lengthy rap sheet.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Christopher is barely 21, already has history of domestic abuse and assault, and now he's facing major time in a room without a view. This hunt won't be easy for Dog.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is always trying to reduce the number of fugitives in Hawaii, so he really doesn't like felons from the mainland combining their flight from the law with an island vacation.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog just can't resist a challenge, especially if it's to help out a friend. Jim is a bondsman and longtime friend of Dog. Jim's son has just started in the family business.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The day starts with Duane Lee and Leland facing off in the kind of court rarely associated with the Chapmans...a tennis court. At stake, as always, are bragging rights for which son can claim the title of "Chapman Champ."

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog likes to say, "The apple doesn't fall far from the tree," and this is a hunt where that is true. So will Dog be able to use one family member's troubled ways to catch another one in trouble with the law?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has only a few days to catch a woman nicknamed Cats or forfeit Beth's $10,000 bond. But it won't be easy - Cats is eight months pregnant, so Dog will have to lure her in rather than risk a violent grab.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Beth have their hands full when they go after their former housekeeper, Lisa, who's jumped bond. They know this case will be tricky because Lisa knows everyone in the family.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's been raining for days and the team is going a little stir crazy. Dog however has the cure--a good hunt. Maui has failed to appear on a drug charge and the team has just one lead.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Facing hard time for forging checks, Melissa pulled a vanishing act at her sentencing hearing, bolting from the courthouse in broad daylight. Lucky for her bondsman, Dog and his posse are in Colorado and ready to help.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog knows that crime and drugs not only damage victims but also harm the families of the perpetrators, especially the kids. And both of the fugitives he's chasing today have left shattered families and struggling women in their wake.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: "When you don't write the bond, you don't know the prey," as Dog always says. So when Dog and team help out a bondsman friend whose client jumped bail, the target is a blank slate. Are his tattoos gang related? Is he likely to be violent?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When the local cops put out an APB for a client with a checked past, Dog springs into action. With the aid of the runner's girlfriend the posse heads out to bring him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When Beth returns to the compound on the Big Island she finds a damaged SUV and two possible culprits--Dog or Justin. Pressed by Beth, Dog offers a third option. The perpetrators are Hawaii's mythical mischief makers--the Menehune!

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back in Hawaii and tracking a dangerous fugitive through the jungles of the Big Island. Their prey is being protected by a ring of family and friends that Dog must forcefully confront to bring in his man.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The bounty-hunter adventures of Duane "Dog" Chapman and his Posse are chronicled in this one hour "Best Of" special, featuring superlative memorable moments from the previous seven seasons.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: A murder investigation leads the Miami homicide team into the heart of a homeless encampment known as Waterworld; the case takes an unexpected turn when the body of another man is found floating in Biscayne Bay three days later.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: A Louisville, Ky., rookie homicide detective attempts to uncover a lead in the case of an unidentified man found dead near a railroad track.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: A retired police captain is killed in Miami and the manhunt extends to New Jersey.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: In Miami, Sgt. Williams and Det. Sanchez investigate the murder of Darrell Harrell, gunned down trying to oust a group of drug dealers; Sgt. Craig Clopton works to solve the murder of Virgil Fuselier, found stabbed to death in his apartment.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: Homicide detectives navigate through false leads and dead ends in the case of a man found beaten to death underneath an interstate; an alleged eyewitness to the crime neglects to mention one major detail.

programme.title: The First 48: The Case That Haunts Me
programme.desc: Dismembered body parts are found floating in Miami's Biscayne Bay, prompting detectives to work around the clock to solve the murder; includes bonus footage.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Once a criminal himself, Dog knows how it feels to be hunted. In this episode of our series that focuses on the tumultuous home and professional life of bounty hunter Dwayne "Dog" Chapman.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The bounty-hunter adventures of Duane "Dog" Chapman and his Posse are chronicled in this one hour "Best Of" special, featuring superlative memorable moments from the previous seven seasons.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is in Denver helping Bobby Brown to track down a fugitive with a long rap sheet. But unfortunately they have no picture of the felon to work with, so the challenges are big on this one.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Other than bringing criminals to justice, one of Dog's loves is teaching the next generation of bounty hunters the tricks of the trade. Today he has a new student.

programme.title: Fugitives Caught on Tape
programme.desc: A car thief in New Mexico steals a vehicle from right under the noses of deputies; police in Wisconsin get in a foot chase with a serial evader; LAPD officers engage in the slow-speed highway pursuit of a suspect on a bicycle.

programme.title: Fugitives Caught on Tape
programme.desc: A truck thief streams his high-speed chase on social media; a man wanted for double murder fires shots at pursuing officers; a man caught sleeping at a traffic light flees police and crashes a high-end sports car; and more.

programme.title: Fugitives Caught on Tape
programme.desc: Law enforcement officers pursue fugitives on the run; a woman accused of shoplifting rams a police cruiser and leads officers on a dangerous high speed chase.

programme.title: Fugitives Caught on Tape
programme.desc: Law enforcement officers pursue fugitives on the run; 911 operators receive a call in the middle of a road rage incident; state troopers pursue a man wanted for domestic assault and fleeing with his 6-year-old son in the car.

programme.title: Fugitives Caught on Tape
programme.desc: Law enforcement officers pursue fugitives on the run; deputies get in a high-speed chase with a man wanted for shooting a highway patrolman and stealing his cruiser; officers pursue a fugitive who's driving recklessly.

programme.title: Fugitives Caught on Tape
programme.desc: Law enforcement officers pursue fugitives on the run; a man wanted for carjacking runs out of the road during a high-speed chase; an officer climbs on the hood of a car while trying to prevent a fugitive from fleeing.

programme.title: Fugitives Caught on Tape
programme.desc: Police and Highway Patrol pull a shoplifting suspect to safety after he hangs from a highway overpass; deputies, air units and K-9 officers chase down a suspect on foot and in the water.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Despite all of our modern technology and sophistication, there is much that we still don't know about what lies beneath our feet, deep underground.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: The total disregard for life exhibited by serial killers shocks our sense of humanity and makes us question our safety and security.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Since the dawn of civilization, humanity has been fixated on predicting our own demise.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: During World War II, a number of persistent mysteries were born, including unexplained stories about everything from lost gold to secret societies and highly advanced technology.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: There's nothing more fascinating than a code that can't be cracked. For centuries, mankind has devised ingenious ways to hide valuable information--using everything from enigmatic puzzles, to complex ciphers and secret symbols. If history's unbreakable codes can be deciphered...could we unlock answers to some of the greatest mysteries of both the past and present?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Since the dawn of humanity, tales of monstrous creatures lurking in the shadows have sparked both fascination and fear; discussing the potential that these stories have elements of reality to them.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: There are many puzzling artifacts from around the world that challenge everything known about the technological capabilities of distant ancestors; some ancient objects are so mysterious they've spawned endless debate and theories.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 70s and early 80s, a terrorist group known as the FALN is suspected of setting off bombs in major U.S. cities. Their goal - to bring attention to the Puerto Rican independence movement. As the bombings escalate, innocent lives are lost. FBI agents and police are is in a deadly race to stop this murderous group with a dangerous cause.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A day that began with a class field trip ended with a parent's worst nightmare. An 11-year-old girl was missing. Her parents were certain she was no runaway. When they failed to find her in their quiet Illinois neighborhood, they called the police. The FBI soon joined the investigation and family and friends worked with detectives and agents in an urgent search for the missing girl. Faced with conflicting witness reports and false leads, agents wouldn't stop until they found the girl, and the truth.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Georgia, a series of bizarre shootings terrorizes the town of East Point. Two people are killed, and two are critically wounded. At first the shootings seem targeted, then they seem random. As the body count climbs, the killer taunts law enforcement with mysterious notes. Agents believe the shooter will continue until he is deador behind bars.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the southwest one serial bank robber claimed his loot went to the poor, but this thief was no folk hero. He had a gun and was willing to shoot. The gunman was desperate to stay free, a threat to anyone in his way. The FBI and U.S. marshals teamed up to capture a resourceful criminal who proved he would never stop fighting.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On a summer afternoon in upscale Lodi, California, a 12-year-old girl is abducted from her home. Scores of police officers and FBI agents converge, determined to find the young girl before it is too late. When the kidnapper's car is discovered in a field near Lodi, police dogs, helicopters, and hundreds of volunteers are employed in a round-the-clock search. It would take a community united in concern for one of their youngest to find the missing child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1996, a group of political extremists twice robbed a bank in Spokane, Washington, using homemade bombs and military precision to escape. The FBI learned that the robbers, part of a shadowy organization called the Phineas Priesthood, might be preparing for a small-scale war with law enforcement. After the suspects were identified, the FBI was faced with the task of safely arresting a group of terrorists with a deadly agenda.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the Spring of 1997, a killer preying on senior citizens terrorizes the River Parish area of Southern Louisiana. By May, local police and the New Orleans FBI are exploring a connection between the April 9 murder of a 71-year old widow and the May 9 murder of a retired couple. A month later, authorities forward information on the crimes to the FBI's Behavioral Science Unit in Quantico, VA, hoping a profile will help them narrow the field of possible suspects.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the mid-1990's, a gang of professional bank robbers raided cities across seven states. Disguises and speed protected their identity from cameras and the police as they stole hundreds of thousands of dollars, always leaving a bomb to terrorize their victims. The stakes were raised when the FBI discovered the robbers had an agenda beyond their personal wealth. To stop these extremists and their growing operation, the FBI needed to capture their leaders.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Washington D.C, a car bomb takes the life of a former ambassador and his secretary. The FBI is on the case and begins sifting through layers of a wide-ranging conspiracy. The scope of the investigation broadens when it becomes apparent that a foreign government, ruled by a ruthless dictator, ordered the attack. Agents and prosecutors must engage in a political tug-of-war to uncover the identities of the assassins.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the 1980s, the drug trade ravages Chicago's inner city neighborhoods and violent crime threatens to destroy entire communities. As drug profits grow, gangs rule the streets. One of the most dangerous is the El Rukns. FBI Agents team up with state and local police to bring them down, but in the process, uncover a bizarre and frightening terrorist plot.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In October 1995, a South Carolina family was taken hostage as part of an elaborately planned bank robbery. Local police quickly identified two of the perpetrators, but the criminal mastermind proved more elusive. After his escape from custody, authorities began to suspect the fugitive of involvement in a series of bank robberies up and down the east coast, and the FBI remained on his trail, hoping to catch him before he took more hostages.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At 9:30 am on the morning of January 30, 1997, Richmond, VA police respond to a report of shots fired at a local bank. Two masked men brandishing automatic weapons confront, and open fire on officers responding to the call. The gunmen exit the bank, and retreat on foot, eventually eluding the officers. The FBI soon responds, only to find one bank teller dead, another wounded, and the bank's security guard shot four times, yet still alive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 70s and early 80s, a terrorist group known as the FALN is suspected of setting off bombs in major U.S. cities. Their goal - to bring attention to the Puerto Rican independence movement. As the bombings escalate, innocent lives are lost. FBI agents and police are is in a deadly race to stop this murderous group with a dangerous cause.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1980's, a pair of serial bank robbers gained a reputation among law enforcement officials as formidable bandits. Using the same modus operandi, the two men took hostages and emptied bank vaults across the Midwest. After the criminals escaped from police custody, FBI agents familiar with the bandits believed that they would attempt a grand-scale heist. By conducting surveillance on known associates of the criminals, authorities tried to anticipate the next target.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, violent militants are intent on turning the US Commonwealth into a communist dictatorship. They murder a policeman, turns their guns on a busload of unarmed Navy workers, and even launch an attack on the FBI. These ruthless killers have vowed to fight to the death. The FBI must use every tactic at their disposal to track down the terrorists and bring them to justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the summer of 1999, Texas was terrorized by a brutal serial killer who traveled by train. The FBI assembled a task force to gather information about the dangerous drifter and create a profile that would help locate him. As they learned that the killer had traveled extensively through the United States and Mexico, the murders became more frequent, and authorities had to cast a dragnet over an entire continent in an effort to catch him.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, the death of a government witness, and the suspicious circumstances surrounding it, lead the FBI and local authorities to suspect corruption in the highest levels of the police force. With the help of a cooperating witness, investigators find the scope of the corruption is far greater that they first thought. Authorities struggle to capture the rouge officers, men who once swore to uphold the law, but now use their power to commit heinous crimes.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Langley, Virginia, a gunman fired into rush hour traffic. The brazen daytime shooting of employees from the Central Intelligence Agency stunned the country. The victims seemed randomly selected, but the motive appeared to be political. The FBI was called in, but the nationwide search quickly became a far-reaching international manhunt. Agents processed more than 2000 leads and crossed an ocean in the effort to deliver justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Wisconsin, a varsity athlete is blindfolded, gagged, and shoved into a van by four gunmen. The kidnappers contact the victim's family and demand $30,000, but offer no instructions on how to transfer the money. The victim's family contacts the police. The boy's captors tell his family they have shot him, and will kill him if they do not receive their money. At an agreed upon drop site, FBI agents approach the captor's vehicle, only to watch them flee and quickly be followed by authorities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 90s, a gang based in the U.S. Virgin Islands began smuggling thousands of kilos of cocaine into mainland America. Police and federal agents target the gang, but its leader remains a mystery. In an investigation spanning from Georgia to South America, local police, the DEA, U.S. Customs and the FBI work together to take down this dangerous drug gang.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1997, a series of crimes in a small Iowa farming community left residents reeling in shock and fear. Two young men went on a crime spree of robbery, kidnapping and murder, and then disappeared. By the time they were identified, they already had a twelve-hour lead. As the hunt for the two men expanded, the FBI committed its resources to tracking down the suspects. The pursuit would take agents across six states to catch the killers before they struck again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the 1980's the New York City Police Department is fighting a losing battle in the war on drugs. Distributors and drug gangs in New York are making millions, and they will do anything to protect their profits. After two law enforcement officers are targeted, hundreds of police officers and FBI agents devise a bold plan to crackdown on the drug gangs and shut down their deadly business.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A New Jersey State Trooper is shot to death on the side of Interstate 80 near the Pennsylvania border. Witnesses to the shooting identify the shooter's car. Police issue an APB, and locate the vehicle hours later. Fingerprinting of the vehicle points to a fugitive wanted on bank robbery charges. Authorities who inspect the fugitive's home find some incriminating evidence including a box of bullets linked to the Trooper's murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In October 1993, a robber surprised unsuspecting customers by dropping through the roof of a California bank. When police arrived, he escaped from the roof in a hail of bullets. A tip from a local resident led police and FBI agents to the perpetrator. They would soon learn that he had masterminded a local kidnapping, and held the fate of an innocent woman in his hands.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1999, Police investigate two brutal murders in two small towns located hundreds of miles apart. The crimes seem random and unrelated, until investigators discover a terrifying link. Local police and the FBI must untangle a web of liesto stop a dangerous gang that will kill a man for his Identity.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A day that began with a class field trip ended with a parent's worst nightmare. An 11-year-old girl was missing. Her parents were certain she was no runaway. When they failed to find her in their quiet Illinois neighborhood, they called the police. The FBI soon joined the investigation and family and friends worked with detectives and agents in an urgent search for the missing girl. Faced with conflicting witness reports and false leads, agents wouldn't stop until they found the girl, and the truth.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In February 1988, a record store clerk in Sandusky, Ohio, was fatally shot in his van. After discovering a night deposit bag with thousands of dollars in the vehicle, police knew that robbery was not the motive, and began to investigate other possibilities. FBI agents learned that several motorcycle gang members had been stopped nearby on a traffic violation shortly after the murder and theorized that the clerk's murder may have been a botched hit carried out by a gang member.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In September 1997, a team of masked gunmen robbed an armored car facility in Los Angeles, and made off with $18.9 million, the largest takeover heist in U.S. history. An employee believed she recognized the voice of one of the robbers, and FBI agents began conducting surveillance on a former employee of the facility. With only one piece of physical evidence, a fragment of a vehicle taillight, authorities hoped to connect him to the crime, and locate his accomplices.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When violent criminals strike, the FBI strikes back, employing every available resource, and creating new ones when necessary. From forensic science to criminal profiling, specialized intelligence to global fugitive tracking, the agents of the FBI battle the bad guys with a most powerful arsenal: the crime-fighter's toolbox. This special episode of The FBI Files celebrates the groundbreaking science, investigative technique, and gut-level instinct that has made the FBI the world's premier law enforcement agency.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, the death of a government witness, and the suspicious circumstances surrounding it, lead the FBI and local authorities to suspect corruption in the highest levels of the police force. With the help of a cooperating witness, investigators find the scope of the corruption is far greater that they first thought. Authorities struggle to capture the rouge officers, men who once swore to uphold the law, but now use their power to commit heinous crimes.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On the day before Thanksgiving, a mother discovered her 10 year-old son was missing from his school. No one knew how it could have happened. Within hours, the boy's entire family was frantically searching for him. The few leads in the case quickly turned cold and the FBI was called in to aid in the investigation. The search by agents and local authorities would cover a thousand miles to expose the kidnapper and find the missing child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1980, extortionists plant a thousand pound bomb in a Nevada casino and demand millions of dollars, or they will detonate the device. The bomb is the largest explosive device the FBI has ever seen. Detonation would be a disaster. Agents and bomb experts must disarm the deadly device, and stop the dangerous extortionist who built it.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 12, 1997, two men use a sledgehammer to break into a Camden, NJ home. The homeowner shoots at the intruders, hitting one in the hand before they escape. Camden Police respond and track the suspects to a nearby park. One of the men shoots at the officer before police arrest his accomplice. The man gives up the identity of the shooter. Twice, police stake out homes where they believe the shooter is hiding, but he eludes them.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1990 and 1991, Chicago police and the FBI were on the trail of a bank robber whose holdups were becoming increasingly violent. The criminal consistently used stolen Japanese cars to carry out the robberies, so authorities hoped to identify him by tracking vehicle thefts. When they finally located the man known as the bearded bandit, they learned that he did not work alone and he had made a pact never to surrender.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Boston, FBI agents and local police tracked a gang of robbers who specialized in armored car takedowns. Their MO was familiar -- the gang used precise timing to steal millions in cash and burned their getaway cars to destroy evidence. As the robberies grew more violent, agents launched a complex sting: To trap a deadly ring of thieves and shut down their dangerous operation.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Philadelphia, a ruthless grab for power leads to a full-scale mob war. The local Mafia crime family splits in two as the young and the old fight to the death. The FBI is caught in the middle as they infiltrate the syndicate through informants and high-tech surveillance. Agents must find a way to bring down the organization before their civil war leads to innocent causalities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A man is found suffocated in his Pennsylvania home, his checkbook, credit cards and vehicle appear to have been stolen. Fingerprints from the victim identify a recent escapee from a minimum-security prison, as well as his girlfriend. Investigators flag the dead man's credit cards, and are alerted when one is used in North Dakota. The FBI is called in and joins another task force already assembled because of a suspected kidnapping.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In July 1996, two men entered a pawnshop in Birmingham, Alabama, and ruthlessly murdered the employees. Unbeknownst to the killers, a secret video surveillance camera recorded the shooting. Local police and the FBI released images of the crime to the media, and were quickly able to identify the perpetrators. Now authorities had to find two cold-blooded killers who knew that they were being pursued for murder one.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On December 21, 1998, two gunmen kidnap three janitors on their way to clean the Bank of America ATM repository in Las Vegas. The gunmen force the janitors to let them in the ATM repository and hold them hostage until the armored car guards arrive to make their nightly collection. When the guards enter the bank, the gunmen surprise them and shoot one guard in the chest before escaping with $1,088,000, the largest bank robbery take in Las Vegas history.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the summer of 1988, a wealthy Jackson, Mississippi woman disappeared from her home in broad daylight. Left behind was a mysterious ransom note listing twelve names and no specific instructions. The note, and a few drops of blood were the only clues to her fate. FBI and local police struggled to find answers in the cryptic message so they could find the kidnapper and retrieve the victim before her time ran out. Solving the crime required the keen insight of a criminal profiler and the perseverance of a family, local authorities, and the FBI.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When the number and volume of bloodstains at the scene was greater than usual, it was up to forensic scientists to find out why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An assistant manager of a Florida steakhouse is stabbed to death. It appears to be a robbery gone wrong, but a bloody fingerprint reveals that he knew his killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 13-year-old girl went missing from her Colorado home, and the only evidencethe kidnapperleft behind was three fingerprints on a window screen.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The victim was a self-made man who never minced words. Perhaps he was murdered by a disgruntled client or employee. Perhaps the racy photos in his safe held the clue to solving the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An aspiring model turned up dead, and the prime suspect was her boyfriend. When he was eventually cleared, investigators had to dig deeper to find the perpetrator. With the help of a forensic geologist, they identified the most unlikely suspects.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1994, Paul Gruber's daughter suspected something was wrong when she received birthday cards addressed from Gruber, on which the handwriting wasn't Gruber's.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Whentwo women went missing and were later found brutally murdered, police wondered if they were victims of a hate crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A human skeleton was discovered in the North Carolina marshlands and, when investigators learned she'd been dead for 18 months, they knew it would be difficult to find out who she was, much less who killed her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a college co-ed vanished without a trace, her fellow students were concerned about her safety and their own.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The medical examiner ruled the death an accident, but the detectives investigating the case thought the evidence at the scene indicated otherwise.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The crime scene was especially violent: A husband and wife had been shot to death in their bedroom. Was their 16-year-daughter complicit?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2000,Kristine Fitzhughfailed to show up for her music class and her husband Ken found her dead at the bottom of the stairs of their Palo Alto home. Upon further investigation, luminol reveals evidence of murder in the kitchen.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Avis Banks and her unborn child were brutally murdered. The body was discovered by her fianc_ Keyon Pittman. Police learn Pittman was having affairs with other women and he became the prime suspect.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2008, Colorado real estate developer Alan Helmick was found shot to death at home by his wife Miriam, who then became the prime suspect.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The bomb was constructed to cause as much damage as possible... and it did, killing the victim with deadly force and flame. A painstaking search yielded tiny clues, which identified the killer as surely as if he'd signed them.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young, attractive hairdresser was sexually assaulted and murdered in her own beauty salon. The evidence at the crime scene didn't match any of the suspects and, after the initial investigation, the case went cold for ten years.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1984, the body of college co-ed Laura Salmon was found on a Middle Tennessee farm, covered with her own denim jeans as well as the jeans of the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of an attractive young woman was found a mile from her abandoned car. Police were especially concerned when they realized the victim had come to them for protection just two weeks earlier, after a road rage incident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A lifelong resident of the tiny town of Lefroy, Tasmania was murdered outside his own home. Robbery appeared to be the motive, but with no suspects, the investigation came to a halt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A six-year-old girl ran and hid when she saw her grandmother being beaten to death, but the man followed, beat and assaulted her. She said the assailant was her uncle, who was convicted. She recanted her testimony years later.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, 54-year-old Gayle Isleib was ambushed in her Manchester, Connecticut driveway and shot to death. Now police must determine if love had turned into obsession... and a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The woman could have lost control of her SUV on the icy road, and plunged down an embankment into a shallow creek. But there were footprints in the snow leading away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A brutal murder, lots of suspects, and conflicting evidence but the forensics were clear on one thing: The killer knew his victim. And that alone gave investigators a head start.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A millionaire and his family were executed in their own home. For three years, the murders went unsolved and then a 30-year-old box of ammunition and some fluorescent fibers revealed the ultimate betrayal.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1969, 25-year-old phone operatorDiane Maxwell is raped and murdered. Her brother promised he'd find out who was responsible and bring the killer to justice.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How unlucky could one man be? His wife took her own life, and his college sweetheart killed herself in much the same fashion fourteen years earlier. Investigators had to determine if this was just a bizarre coincidence, or murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1994, 19-year-old Shannon Melendi disappeared while at Emory University. For ten years, her disappearance remained a mystery, until new scientific testing cast a different light on Colvin 'Butch' Hinton.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: This episode documents a deadly bombing at a church in Oakwood, Illinois, in December 1997.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2005, David Castor suffered a slow, agonizing death over a period of days. His wifeStaceymaintained it was suicide, even though it was done with antifreeze.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young fireman died from what appeared to be serious but undiagnosed heart disease, his family and friends were devastated but they had no proof of foul play.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A World War II veteran was found dead in his home, and the investigation ground to a halt when the prime suspect had a solid alibi. But a lucky break led to a shady character who wore distinctive boots and had a sweet tooth.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A murder trail turned cold, until police got a call from a woman whose husband, Gerald Powers, had a criminal past and a fondness for Chevy Berettas.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2003, St. Cloud teenager Jason MacLennan returned home after a night out with friends and discovered his father Ken's body lying in a pool of blood.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2004, Rebecca Barney and her soon-to-be ex-husband Fred were found shot to death in their Tulsa, Oklahoma, home, which had been set on fire.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a woman went missing, friends and family were determined to find her. Their worst fears were confirmed weeks later when her body was discovered.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1993, 82-year-old Kathryn Bishop was found dead in her Pennsylvania home. Tiny clues on the victim's body would tell police what happened that night.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It's usually easy to determine how a criminal entered the crime scene. But in this case, it was far from clear. It looked like the killer vanished into thin air...and perhaps he had.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1986, Gary Dale Larson was stabbed to death in his Edmond, Oklahoma home and then the killer sexually assaulted Larson's girlfriend Janet Haynes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman attends evening church services... then disappears. When her abandoned car is found, the tank is empty and a gas can she kept in her trunk for emergencies is missing.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A twelve-year-old girl claimed she had been abducted and sexually assaulted. She recounted what happened in such a flat, unemotional voice that police found it difficult to believe her. Fibers on her clothing would prove she was telling the truth.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On May 20, 2001, Carrie Nelson, then 20, was beaten to death while working alone in a park office. The case went unsolved for six years until May 2007 when police found a match with DNA samples gathered from the crime scene.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Lives changed in the 20 years following an unsolved murder, and so did forensic science. In time, a high-powered microscope and DNA profiling revealed not only a clue no one had seen before but also the identity of the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: James Kenneth Elmen Jr. abducted Julie Estes, then 21, from the Southside convenience store where she worked in 1985. He raped and murdered her. Her body was found the next day, but the killing went unsolved until 2003.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2000, Judy Southern arrived home from work and was shot by a gunman waiting within. Her husband Allen arrived shortly afterwards, called 911 to report his wife had been shot and drove her to the hospital.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The woman had been sexually assaulted, stabbed repeatedly, and left for dead. When someone who fit that description practically turned himself in, police were sure they had their man... until the DNA evidence proved them wrong.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1996, when Derrick Duehren returned to his Oregon home, it had burned to the ground and his wife Roxanne's charred remains were found in the rubble. Investigators set out to determine if it was an unfortunate accident or arson and murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On Halloween night 2004, Adriane Insogna and Leslie Mazzara were brutally murdered in their Napa, California home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The killer probably hoped to cover his tracks by staging the crime scene. But investigators saw through the attempt almost immediately, and turned to forensic science to learn what really happened that night.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An aspiring model turned up dead, and the prime suspect was her boyfriend. When he was eventually cleared, investigators had to dig deeper to find the perpetrator. With the help of a forensic geologist, they identified the most unlikely suspects.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2000, when teenager Tara Munsey goes missing after a work shift at a Virginia restaurant, it is unknown if she ran away or if she was the victim of foul play.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1984, the body of college co-ed Laura Salmon was found on a Middle Tennessee farm, covered with her own denim jeans as well as the jeans of the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In the 1990s, the media dubbed Richard Rogers the 'Last Call Killer' because he targeted men in gay bars who were obviously intoxicated.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A security guard disappeared from his post without a trace; his remains were found a year later in a remote camp site.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The development of technology could help solve a murder case that is twelve years old.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2002, funeral director Lonnie Turner, Sr. was found shot to death. His son Lonnie Jr. became the prime suspect, particularly after it was discovered that the murder was committed with his gun. However, he had an alibi for the time of the murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: On May 20, 2001, Carrie Nelson, then 20, was beaten to death while working alone in a park office. The case went unsolved for six years until May 2007 when police found a match with DNA samples gathered from the crime scene.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A serial killer was on the loose and police had to find him before he struck again. Their most promising lead was an unusual one: a bloody fingerprint on the body of one of the victims.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1993, young mother Tammy Tatum was found sexually assaulted and murdered in her Longmont, Colorado apartment. Police initially suspected her estranged husband, but did not have enough evidence to charge him and the case went cold.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A human skeleton was discovered in the North Carolina marshlands and, when investigators learned she'd been dead for 18 months, they knew it would be difficult to find out who she was, much less who killed her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Doctors don't know why the young scientist is gravely ill. When tests finally reveal the cause, it's too late to save him. Police hope that lab analysis of his hair, showing when attempts were made on his life and what was used will lead to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A surgeon is stabbed to death, and the most likely suspect is seen in a restaurant at the time of the murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was one of the most brazen crimes of the 20th century.Adolph Coors III, chairman of the Coors Brewing Company, was kidnapped and held for ransom prompting one of the most intense manhunts in United States history.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: They thought the fire would cover their crime. But one tiny clue, no bigger than a thumbtack, remained. It held all the information investigators needed to put a trio of cold-blooded killers behind bars.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 13-year-old girl went missing from her Colorado home, and the only evidencethe kidnapperleft behind was three fingerprints on a window screen.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Even though their daughter had run away before, she'd always come back. Her parents were sure this time would be no different, but they were wrong.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How did the stalker obtain the security system code for his victim's home? How did he steal her personal photographs? Police needed answers, and they found them in the most unlikely of places.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a hit-and-run accident claimed the life of a high school athlete, everyone in town mourned his passing. Finding the killer was a long shot at best.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 2006, Darlene VanderGiesen received threatening emails and then disappeared. Tracking the source of the emails led police to the home of Daphne Wright, where they believe a murder was committed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a nine-year-old girl goes missing, police and volunteers spend weeks searching for her. A psychic's vision leads to a field where her body is discovered, along with what investigators hope is enough evidence to help them to also find her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.desc: Meet Gary and Karen, hes a little adventurous, and shes a little stay-at-home, but it will all change after 12 years of marriage. Kinga, Gary, and Karen embark on a crash course in adventure through the Granite State.

programme.title: KCCI Local News
programme.desc: Get the latest news and weather from KCCI.

programme.title: Mo Gaba: Spirit Lives Forever
programme.desc: How a child living with cancer changed the Baltimore sports community forever.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Witness extreme car chases captured on video, from fleeing via fire truck to off-roading into a corn field. Fortunately no one is seriously hurt except, at times, the vehicles.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A 12-year-old paperboy's disappearance during his Sunday morning route shocks a peaceful Iowa city. Panic sets in when a second paperboy goes missing.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: In Milwaukee, 19-year-old Sade Robinson has gone missing, and her car is found torched. A trail of evidence across the city shocks the community and leaves her family searching for justice.

programme.title: Rickwood
programme.desc: This is the story of the oldest professional ballpark in the U.S. and the determination of its home team, the Black Barons. The voice of Rickwood tells the tale of its pivotal role in The Negro League, Black history and its legacy in American sports.

programme.title: This is Iowa
programme.desc: The Room Where it Happens: A bowling alley where a 9-year-old rolls a perfect game, Carver Hawkeye Arena as Caitlin Clark wows crowds, a ballroom where fans mark the day the music died, and a therapy room where an injured teen learns to walk again.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Two serial killers whose chilling crimes left their communities devastated.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Fight for your right to start the day right with a 90s-themed breakfast. Climb aboard a bicycle built for twelve, and cruise between boozy destinations that feature everything from classy cocktails to intoxicating IV bags.

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: Renowned singer Vicente Griego takes Amanda on a cultural journey steeped in traditionfrom learning the basics of flamenco dance to watching how custom guitars are crafted at a family-run workshop.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: At only 21 years old, Isabelle Sander has overcome a lot in her young life with hearing loss. However, to prove to herself and others that a diagnosis doesn't define a person, she is on a mission to participate in nature and be active outdoors.

programme.title: The Spark
programme.desc: Erica Powell will not be slowed down. After cancer treatments as an infant left her legally blind, she is fueled to become a world-class athlete and a beacon of inspiration to others.

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.
